area_name: Sandwich Spire West Face (New York Deli Wall)

content.description: Wide crack on north side of New York Deli Wall. Surprisingly chossy. I was expecting a lot more from this climb: 2 *'s in guidebook, accolades from folks who have climbed it. That being said it disappointed... If you want to do something wide in the vicinity, get on Chicken Co-op on South Fin, that, is incredible!
content.location: Starts on same ledge as New York Deli and The New Yorker.

content.description: Great Rock quality and great vertical climbing with a good length of crux right in the middle.  Unlike  some other Windy Point area classics the holds will stay put on this climb.
content.protection: 12 bolts to two bolt anchor on top of the formation.  Why are there no chains as it says in the guidebook?  I'm not sure, but they would be nice to have.  You can hike off easy enough if you need to clean from the top.  Bolts are set back off the top which prevents lowering from them very easily.
content.location: If you are in the gully this is the first bolted route on the far left.

content.description: Another great 11 on a great wall. No chains on this one. We built a gear anchor to lower on and cleaned it on the way out. Little more old school in the bolting than most routes on this wall

Excellent route with a multitude of cruxes. The bottom (gear section) has been (seemingly) retro-bolted. Additionally at least one bolt was added higher up, lessening the runout be/ the old smc hangers
content.protection: bolts (small cams and nuts would protect the 1st quarter)
content.location: North side of the west facing Sandwich Spire (aka New York Deli Wall). shares the first bolt w/ The New Yorker.

climbs.name: Hoagie Crease
climbs.fa: Ron Farrel, Scott Ayers, & Steve Schneider (1989)

content.description:
For the sport variation, ascend the buttress using a broken crack, being cognizant of the tree behind.  Positive in-cuts appear as the buttress gives way to a slightly undulating, green face.  Follow bolts up moderate terrain with an abundance of deep flakes.  A shallow scoop with fewer features and a perplexing finish earn the grade. 

  While none of the flakes broke during our visit, thoughtful selection of which features to use is recommended.  I may have just been paranoid as this was our first climb of the day.
content.protection:
This climb has two starts: 

 Left: Sport. Bolts and chains. Right: Mixed. Gear to three inches recommended.
content.location: Hoagie Crease is the furthest right route on the west face of the Sandwich Spire.  To the right are two sport routes on the south face, The Big Apple and Wish Sandwich.  To the left is New York Goes To Chicago.

content.description: Fun romp up plates on south-western buttress of Sandwich Spire.  When the plates become tea-saucers you've reached the crux.
content.location: rap down spire (at writing, there were hangers on the bolts above Hoagie Crease) and find route starting on southwest toe

pathTokens: Sandwich Spire West Face (New York Deli Wall)

content.description: The West Face of Sandwich Spire is in a tight gully that gets very little sun.  The approach, which is a royal pain of downed oak and Manzanita bush-whacking, will almost guarantee that you will be alone should you venture to this crag.  Should you choose to accept the approach mission you will find great rock quality with many sport routes in the 5.10-11 range.
